casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff—Appellee, v. Efran Castaneda APARICIO, a.k.a. Efren Castaneda Aparicio Efrain Aparicio, Defendant—Appellant. No. 08-50051. United States Court of Appeals, Ninth Circuit. Aug. 11, 2008.* Filed Aug. 19, 2008. Brock H. Lunsford, Michael J. Raphael, Office of the U.S. Attorney, Los Angeles, CA, for Plaintiff-Appellee. Gia Kim, Federal Public Defender’s Office, Los Angeles, CA, for Defendant-Appellant.

Before: CANBY, LEAVY and KLEINFELD, Circuit Judges.

The panel unanimously finds this case suitable for decision without oral argument. See Fed. R.App. P. 34(a)(2).

MEMORANDUM **

Appellant’s unopposed motion for summary reversal and remand is granted. See *65Fed.R.Crim.P. 11(c)(1)(C); (5). Defendant’s sentence is vacated and this matter is remanded to the district court for resentencing.

Appellant’s request for reassignment is granted. Upon remand, this matter shall be reassigned to a different district judge.

REVERSED AND REMANDED.

This disposition is not appropriate for publication and is not precedent except as provided by 9th Cir. R. 36-3.
